TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricKeyExchangeFormatter

Docs.summary: Creates the PKCS#1 key exchange data using .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Key exchange allows a sender to create secret information (such as random data that can be used as a key in a symmetric encryption algorithm) and use encryption to send it to the intended recipient.
Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeDeformatter> to receive the key exchange and extract the secret information from it.
> [!CAUTION] > We recommend that you do not attempt to create your own key exchange method from the basic functionality provided, because many details of the operation must be performed carefully in order for the key exchange to be successful.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter> class to create an exchange key for a message recipient.
[!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1keyexchangeformatter2/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1keyexchangeformatter2/vb/program.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter.SetKey%2A> method to set the key to be used for key exchange before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter.CreateKeyExchange%2A>.

Docs.param: The instance of the algorithm that holds the public key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] CreateKeyExchange(unsigned int8[] rgbData) cil managed

Docs.param: The secret information to be passed in the key exchange.
Docs.summary: Creates the encrypted key exchange data from the specified input data.
Docs.returns: The encrypted key exchange data to be sent to the intended recipient.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This data can be interpreted only by the holder of the private key corresponding to the public key used to encrypt the data. This helps to ensure that only the intended recipient can access the secret information.

MemberSignature.Value: public override byte[] CreateKeyExchange (byte[] rgbData, Type symAlgType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] CreateKeyExchange(unsigned int8[] rgbData, class System.Type symAlgType) cil managed

Docs.param: The secret information to be passed in the key exchange.
This parameter is not used in the current version.
Docs.summary: Creates the encrypted key exchange data from the specified input data.
Docs.returns: The encrypted key exchange data to be sent to the intended recipient.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This data can be interpreted only by the holder of the private key corresponding to the public key used to encrypt the data. This helps to ensure that only the intended recipient can access the secret information.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter.CreateKeyExchange%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create an exchange key for a message recipient. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter2#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1keyexchangeformatter2/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1keyexchangeformatter2/vb/program.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets the parameters for the PKCS #1 key exchange.
Docs.value: An XML string containing the parameters of the PKCS #1 key exchange operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter.Parameters%2A> property returns an XML string that contains Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) that describe the parameters of the PKCS #1 key exchange operation. Note that the URIs are not guaranteed to point to active addresses.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the random number generator algorithm to use in the creation of the key exchange.
Docs.value: The instance of a random number generator algorithm to use.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is `null`, the default random number generator algorithm is used.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetKey(class System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm key) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance of the algorithm that holds the public key.
Docs.summary: Sets the public key to use for encrypting the key exchange data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must set the key before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1KeyExchangeFormatter.CreateKeyExchange%2A>.
